history.content:
Most people are on break/vacation right now.

Wait for the semester to start again, and maybe visit the professors in person (e.g. during office hours) if they still don't respond to an email then.

Grade are not official until some time in the first week of January. That means the professor can easily change them until then. Maybe they haven't factored in a final assignment or double checked their work yet. You email was the right thing to do, and I would send a follow up today if you haven't already. 

If they disagree or you haven't head back once grades are transferred to your transcript, check out this information from the Office of the Registrar:

Appeal a Grade

If you believe your instructor submitted an incorrect grade because of a clerical (for example, computational) or procedural error, please speak directly with your instructor.

If you believe that your instructor has used nonacademic criteria (for example, race, religion, gender, or politics) in assigning your grade, you can appeal the grade. Begin the process by speaking with your instructor and/or the Students Ombudsperson.

Your next step is to try to resolve the issue by speaking with the department chair. If you cannot resolve your dispute informally, there is a formal procedure you can follow that is outlined in the Berkeley Academic Guideunder "Academic Policies."
I believe there is some mistake on my grade shown on the bcourse. I emailed all the professors and TAs, but no one responded to me in three days. What should I do next?
history.subject: Appeal for my grade
